steps.titleHtml: Welcome to the WONE Assessment
steps.subtitleHtml:
This assessment will take you around 4 minutes.

It has been developed with leading scientists and measures your stress resilience across 3 pillars of resilience, energy and activity.

When you're finished, you'll see your scores and receive recommendations.

Your privacy is our top priority. Your responses are confidential and we will never share individual data with your employer.

steps.titleHtml: Resilience
steps.subtitleHtml: This first pillar assesses how you handle work-related stress and personal challenges, as well as your mental resilience and management strategies.

steps.titleHtml: How often have you felt stressed at work in the last two weeks?
How often have you felt anxious at work in the last two weeks?
How often have you been upset by unexpected, work-related events in the last two weeks?
How often have you struggled to manage your emotions at work in the last two weeks?
How often have you felt overwhelmed by work tasks in the last two weeks?
To what extent has stress negatively impacted your work in the last two weeks?
How stressed have you felt in your personal life outside of work in the last two weeks?

steps.subtitleHtml: Thinking generally, to what extent do you agree with the following statements:

steps.titleHtml: I can easily adapt to challenges
I have a trusted support system in my life
I believe that experiencing stress helps me to grow
I use effective techniques to manage stress
My mental resilience and stress management is an area I want to improve

steps.subtitleHtml: The following questions are designed to help you reflect and your responses will help WONE learn about important stressors impacting well-being. They do not contribute to your Index score.

steps.titleHtml: What has been the biggest source of work-related stress in the last two weeks?
What has been the biggest source of stress in your personal life in the last two weeks?
Energy
steps.subtitleHtml: This second pillar assesses the quality of your sleep and your sleeping habits, as well as your overall sense of energy.

steps.titleHtml: On average, how many hours have you slept each night in the last two weeks?
How would you rate the overall quality of your sleep in the last two weeks?
How often have you struggled to fall asleep within 30 minutes of trying to fall asleep in the last two weeks?
How often have you struggled staying asleep in the last two weeks, where you wake up in the middle of the night and have trouble getting back to sleep or wake up earlier than you normally would?
How would you rate your overall energy levels in the last two weeks?
To what extent have low energy levels negatively affected your work in the last two weeks?

steps.subtitleHtml: Please select the answer that best describes your experience over the last 2 weeks:

steps.titleHtml: I maintain a consistent sleep routine, going to bed and waking up at the same time each day
I wake up each morning feeling refreshed
I rely on caffeine to function effectively
I rely on sugary snacks to get through my workday
I feel exhausted at the end of my workday
My sleep quality and energy levels is an area I want to improve
Activity
steps.subtitleHtml: This final pillar assesses how physically active you are and how your body feels, as well as how nutritious and balanced your diet is.

steps.titleHtml: How would you rate your overall level of physical activity in the last two weeks?
Have you experienced any physical bodily pain or tension during your working day in the last two weeks?
Have you experienced any physical bodily pain or tension after your working day in the last two weeks?

steps.subtitleHtml: Please select the answer that best describes your experience over the last 2 weeks:

steps.titleHtml: I engage in physical activity that is vigorous enough to raise my breathing/heart rate for a total of 150 minutes or more per week (e.g. cycling, running, aerobic exercises)
I eat 5-10 portions of a variety of fresh vegetables and fruit each day
I eat ultra-processed foods, ready meals or take-aways as part of my diet (e.g. packaged snacks, pre-made sauces, fast food, sugary drinks, processed meat/meat alternatives)
I eat healthy fats as part of my diet (e.g. oily fish, avocado, nuts, seeds, and olive oil)

In a typical week, how many units of alcohol do you consume?

For reference, 1 unit = 1/2 pint of "regular" beer/lager/cider, or 1/2 a small glass of wine, or 1 single 25ml measure of spirits
On an average day, how much water/herbal tea do you drink?
To what extent has your physical health negatively affected your work in the last two weeks?
My physical fitness and nutrition is an area I want to improve
Finally, how did you find completing this Assessment?
steps.subtitleHtml: This is valuable feedback to help WONE understand ways to improve this measure.

options.label:
YES, 
TAKE ME TO THE COMPANY QUESTIONS

NO, 
I DON'T WANT TO SHARE COMPANY INSIGHTS

steps.titleHtml:
Well done! Your scores are waiting...

Can you spare 1 more minute?
steps.subtitleHtml:
We periodically want to ask you a few important questions to understand your working environment and how it impacts you.

Your anonymous answers will be used to provide valuable insights for the people and wellbeing strategy at your company. They will not be included in your personal Index score.

It won't take long, only 1-2 minutes.

steps.titleHtml: Your Company
steps.subtitleHtml:
This section is designed to understand your working environment and how it impacts you.

Your anonymous responses will be used to provide insights for the people and wellbeing strategy at your company and they will not be included in your personal Index score.

steps.titleHtml: I have responsibilities in managing or supervising others in my role
Our work culture actively supports personal well-being
I am receiving adequate support for my well-being from my manager
I can allocate sufficient time at work to focus on my well-being
I successfully balance my professional and personal life
My current workload is manageable
I have the freedom to make decisions about my work processes
I receive necessary support from my colleagues
My work relationships are generally harmonious
I can make a mistake at work without worrying people will hold it against me
We're able to bring up problems and tough issues at work
I feel comfortable voicing my ideas at work without fear of negative consequences
How would you rate your overall level of productivity at work over the last two weeks?
Well done on completing your WONE Assessment
steps.subtitleHtml: We're going to take you back to your profile so that you can see your complete WONE Index results and start exploring recommendations.
